item.title: GET `/faces`
item.description: Use this endpoint to find which Twemojis are supported as faces. Knowing whether a Twemoji is supported as a face can help in formulating other requests that don't fail. Arguments Name Required Type Default twemoji_version âŒ String 13.1.0 Chart.platform.disableCSSInjection = true; function getCanvas(id){ return document.

item.title: GET `/faces/features`
item.description: Use this endpoint to view the layers of Twemojis that are supported as faces indexed by features. item.title: GET `/faces/{base_emoji}`
item.description: Use this endpoint to build a custom Twemoji using one as a base. Arguments Name Required Type Default base_emoji âœ… String none head âŒ String base emoji cheeks âŒ String base emoji mouth âŒ String base emoji nose âŒ String base emoji eyes âŒ String base emoji eyewear âŒ String base emoji headwear âŒ String base emoji other âŒ String base emoji order âŒ String head,cheeks,mouth,nose,eyes,eyewear,headwear,other output âŒ String JSON file_format âŒ String SVG renderer âŒ String N/A due to SVG file format size âŒ Integer N/A due to SVG file format padding âŒ Integer 0 background_color âŒ String transparent filename âŒ String key-value pairs twemoji_version âŒ String 13.
